target_text: "OK, great. Software quality is the end result. It has a structural perspective which is the code and the design. It has also an external component which is free of defects and meets the end user requirements."

Codebook.Definition: The overall standard of the software as determined by its ability to meet user requirements and be free of defects.
The aspect of software quality that focuses on the underlying code and design elements.
The part of software quality that relates to the software's performance in real-world scenarios, particularly its defect-free status.
The specific needs and expectations of the end users that the software must fulfill.
